results.title: Women in sports an informal history
results.creator_credit: Altana Films, Dan Klugherz and Arthur Zitrin
results.brief_description: Surveys the participation of women in sports from classical times to the present day. Discusses prejudice against the physically active woman, the growing awareness of women’s rights as sports participants, and the new enthusiasm of women for sports. Incorporates archival footage and drawings and features famous sportswomen including, Sonja Henie, Margaret Smith-Court, and Billie Jean King.

results.title: Women in rock
results.brief_description: All the legendary women of Rock n Roll are brought together in this collage of artists and their music. Through a music-driven mix of rare historical footage, music videos, riveting live performances and personal interviews, the lives and times of the greatest women in rock history are revealed. Featured musical performances include Carole King, Aretha Franklin, Tina Turner, Janis Joplin, Pat Benatar and Madonna, among others.

results.title: Women in revolt
results.creator_credit: Factory Films, Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey
results.brief_description: Peter Morrissey and Andy Warhol collaborate in this mordant satire about the women’s movement and its impact. Three transvestites - Holly Woodlawn, Jackie Curtis, and Candy Darling - play the three lead roles, and in a series of melodramas, rage about their lot and how to overcome it. In an attempt at liberation the women launch a revolutionary feminist group called PIGS (Politically Involved Girls). With three extravagant, outrageous performances, this is more stream-of-consciousness theatre than linear cinema, providing a brilliant lampooning of society and 1970s feminism.

results.title: Women in management: threat or opportunity
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, CRM Productions and Barbara Jampel
results.brief_description: Examines the effects of the women’s liberation movement in several different organisations and then shows the many ways, both good and bad, in which leaders and managers are dealing with the situation. Shows how a traditionally male-dominated company has adapted to changing sex roles through an organised program. This film can be used to explore the possible attitudes and hindrances to career progress which girls may face. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Women in mainstream cinema
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, AFTRS, Margaret Pomeranz, Ian Phipps and Geoff Cawthorn
results.brief_description: Why are women so absent in terms of story, character and integrity, age and exprience in mainstream cinema? Is it just too threatening to have women portrayed as they are in real life, or is it that women’s issues are not real issues? Why could women on screen in the 30’s and 40’s be much more than the undevelopped romantic props they often are today. Hear what top Australian critics think and then have your say.

results.title: Women in love
results.creator_credit: Brandywine Productions, Larry Kramer and Ken Russell
results.brief_description: Director Ken Russell, (Tommy, Altered States, Crimes of Passion), gave the world notice he was a major filmmaking force with “Women in love”, based on D.H. Lawrence’s erotic, mesmerising classic novel set in 1920’s England. Nominated for four Oscars (1970) including Best Direction, “Women in love” remarkably brings D.H. Lawrence’s complex characters to life. Alan Bates, Jennie Linden, Oliver Reed and Glenda Jackson are superb in their portrayal of the mismatched pairs swept up in love, lust, inhibition, rage, jealousy and hate with the then little-known Glenda Jackson winning an Academy Award for her role. “Women in love” is a feast for the emotions, the eyes and the mind.

results.title: Women in kimono
results.creator_credit: Koga Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A look at Japanese culture showing the influence of nature in all spheres of life. With no narration, using only Japanese music as background, the film shows the design of fabrics for kimonos, the making of delicate porcelain, silk screen painting and ikebana.

results.title: Women in change
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A history of Australia’s women looking specifically at: the suffragette movement; the campaign for equal pay; women and unionism; abortion; contraception, sexual harassment; and politics.

results.creator_credit: Classroom Video Productions and Cathy Miller
results.brief_description: A discussion starter which looks at: changes in attitudes towards Australian women since 1900 and historical filmclips, contemporary footage and interviews showing women’s different roles and images.
